interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Django Unchained
Review Date: 2021/07/04
Store: Jamie Foxx  (Actor),     Christoph Waltz  (Actor),     Quentin Tarantino  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, All Lionsgate Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Set in the South two years before the Civil War, DJANGO UNCHAINED stars Academy Award ®-winner Jamie Foxx as Django, a slave whose brutal history with his former owners lands him face-to-face with a German-born bounty hunter Dr. King Schultz (Academy Award®-winner Christolph Waltz). Schultz is on the trail of the murderous Brittle brothers, and only Django can lead him to his bounty. The unorthodox Schultz acquires Django with a promise to free him upon the capture of the Brittles – dead or alive. Success leads Schultz to free Django, though the two men choose not to go their separate ways. Instead, Schultz seeks out the South’s most wanted criminals with Django by his side. Honing vital hunting skills, Django remains focused on one goal: finding and rescuing Broomhilda (Kerry Washington), the wife he lost to the slave trade long ago. Django and Schultz’s search ultimately leads them to Calvin Candie (Academy Award®-nominee Leonardo DiCaprio), the proprietor of “Candyland,” an infamous plantation. Exploring the compound under false pretenses, Django and Schultz rouse the suspicion of Stephen (Academy Award®-nominee Samuel L. Jackson), Candie’s trusted house slave. Their moves are marked, and a treacherous organization closes in on them. If Django and Schultz are to escape with Broomhilda, they must choose between independence and solidarity, between sacrifice and survival…', 'Amazon.com', "From the moment Jamie Foxx throws off a filthy, tattered blanket to reveal a richly muscled back crisscrossed with long scars, it's obvious that", 'Django Unchained', "will be both true to its exploitation roots but also clear-eyed about the misery that's being exploited. Django (Foxx), a slave set free in the years before the Civil War, joins with a German dentist-turned-bounty hunter (the marvelous Christoph Waltz,", 'Inglourious Basterds', "), who has promised to help Django rescue his wife (Kerry Washington), who's still enslaved to a gleeful and grandiose plantation owner (Leonardo DiCaprio, plainly relishing the opportunity to play an out-and-out villain). What follows is a wild and woolly ride, crammed with all the pleasures one expects from a revenge fantasy written and directed by Quentin Tarantino. Plot-wise, some things happen a little too easily (for example, Django instantly becomes a master gunslinger), but the moral perspective is not glib. For all its lurid violence and jazzy dialogue, this is a still-rare movie that paints slavery for what it was: a brutal, dehumanizing practice that allowed a privileged few to profit from the suffering of many, a practice guaranteed by the gun and the whip. Think of it as the antidote to", 'Gone with the Wind', '. Tarantino is more heartfelt in', 'Django Unchained', 'than in any of his previous movies--without sacrificing any of the pell-mell action, tension, and delicious language that made', 'Reservoir Dogs', ',', 'Kill Bill', ', and', 'Pulp Fiction', 'so very enjoyable.', '--Bret Fetzer']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Western', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Jamie Foxx, Pilar Savone, Stacey Sher, Don Johnson, Kerry Washington, Franco Nero, Walton Goggins, James Remar, Leonardo DiCaprio, Michael Parks, Brown 26 Productions, LLC, Dennis Christopher, Reginald Hudlin, Christoph Waltz, Quentin Tarantino, Samuel JacksonJamie Foxx, Pilar Savone, Stacey Sher, Don Johnson, Kerry Washington, Franco Nero, Walton Goggins, James Remar, Leonardo DiCaprio, Michael Parks, Brown 26 Productions, LLC, Dennis Christopher, Reginald Hudlin, Christoph Waltz, Quentin Tarantino, Samuel Jackson  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 46 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '13132597256', 'Director': 'Quentin Tarantino', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 46 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 16, 2013', 'Actors': 'Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio, Kerry Washington, Samuel Jackson', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Reginald Hudlin, Pilar Savone, Stacey Sher', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: Garbage
Review Title: Garbage
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Squanto: A Warrior's Tale
Drama, Adventure, Thrilling, Ambitious
['Squanto, a young warrior abducted from his homeland and enslaved, must battle impossible hazards on a desperate journey home. Driven by a passion to be free, he risks everything to escape his captors.']
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Xavier Koller'], 'Producers': ['Kathryn F. Galan'], 'Starring': ['Adam Beach', 'Eric Schweig', 'Michael Gambon']}
A historically inaccurate piece of trash.  Whoever was the consultant/scriptwriter of this film, is an ignoramus of history.  After watching this film in agony on Thanksgiving eve,  I wanted to fall on my spear.
Worst Thanksgiving movie ever!
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Ford'], 'Producers': ['Sol M. Wurtzel'], 'Starring': ['Will Rogers', 'Anita Louise', 'Tom Brown'], 'Studio': ['Reel Enterprises']}

Excellent Movie Depicting a Long Gone Era!

Good price and fast delivery

95% of the movie was a boring story line of a teenage romance. The only funny part was the stand-in parents. Don't waste your money. Wait for the snippets on Youtube.
Boring Teen Girl movie.

It is fitting for 2020, a horrible year.
A pandemic comedy.....not

Seasons 1-4 engaged the viewer by twists in the plot. However,  season 5 is boring as h*ll and the characters are pretentious. Wendy and Taylor can go bye bye.
Horrible season
Created Equal: Clarence Thomas In His Own Words
Clarence Thomas  (Actor),     Joe Biden  (Actor),     Michael Pack  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
['Although Clarence Thomas remains a controversial figure, few know him beyond his contentious U.S. Supreme Court confirmation battle. But behind the headlines, Thomas life is a classic American tale: born poor in the segregated South, only to become one of the most influential justices in the highest court of the land. Created Equal tells Thomas life story truly and fully, without cover-ups or distortions.']

['Product Description', 'Set in the South two years before the Civil War, DJANGO UNCHAINED stars Academy Award ®-winner Jamie Foxx as Django, a slave whose brutal history with his former owners lands him face-to-face with a German-born bounty hunter Dr. King Schultz (Academy Award®-winner Christolph Waltz). Schultz is on the trail of the murderous Brittle brothers, and only Django can lead him to his bounty. The unorthodox Schultz acquires Django with a promise to free him upon the capture of the Brittles – dead or alive. Success leads Schultz to free Django, though the two men choose not to go their separate ways. Instead, Schultz seeks out the South’s most wanted criminals with Django by his side. Honing vital hunting skills, Django remains focused on one goal: finding and rescuing Broomhilda (Kerry Washington), the wife he lost to the slave trade long ago. Django and Schultz’s search ultimately leads them to Calvin Candie (Academy Award®-nominee Leonardo DiCaprio), the proprietor of “Candyland,” an infamous plantation. Exploring the compound under false pretenses, Django and Schultz rouse the suspicion of Stephen (Academy Award®-nominee Samuel L. Jackson), Candie’s trusted house slave. Their moves are marked, and a treacherous organization closes in on them. If Django and Schultz are to escape with Broomhilda, they must choose between independence and solidarity, between sacrifice and survival…', 'Amazon.com', "From the moment Jamie Foxx throws off a filthy, tattered blanket to reveal a richly muscled back crisscrossed with long scars, it's obvious that", 'Django Unchained', "will be both true to its exploitation roots but also clear-eyed about the misery that's being exploited. Django (Foxx), a slave set free in the years before the Civil War, joins with a German dentist-turned-bounty hunter (the marvelous Christoph Waltz,", 'Inglourious Basterds', "), who has promised to help Django rescue his wife (Kerry Washington), who's still enslaved to a gleeful and grandiose plantation owner (Leonardo DiCaprio, plainly relishing the opportunity to play an out-and-out villain). What follows is a wild and woolly ride, crammed with all the pleasures one expects from a revenge fantasy written and directed by Quentin Tarantino. Plot-wise, some things happen a little too easily (for example, Django instantly becomes a master gunslinger), but the moral perspective is not glib. For all its lurid violence and jazzy dialogue, this is a still-rare movie that paints slavery for what it was: a brutal, dehumanizing practice that allowed a privileged few to profit from the suffering of many, a practice guaranteed by the gun and the whip. Think of it as the antidote to", 'Gone with the Wind', '. Tarantino is more heartfelt in', 'Django Unchained', 'than in any of his previous movies--without sacrificing any of the pell-mell action, tension, and delicious language that made', 'Reservoir Dogs', ',', 'Kill Bill', ', and', 'Pulp Fiction', 'so very enjoyable.', '--Bret Fetzer']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests in Film Genres:** The user maintains a strong preference for drama and adventure films with intricate plots, coupled with an aversion to lighter genres lacking emotional depth or originality.

- **Value for Historical Accuracy:** They appreciate historically accurate narratives, growing increasingly critical of formulaic or emotionally unengaging content, highlighting a desire for unique storytelling.

- **Critical Reviewing Style:** The user demonstrates a discerning taste, consistently providing strong negative feedback when narratives fail to captivate, emphasizing high expectations for quality character development and storytelling.

- **Emotional Engagement:** Their commitment to emotional depth is significant, as they express dissatisfaction with content that doesn’t resonate, even in lighter genres.

- **Expectations for Quality:** The user prioritizes compelling narratives that offer complexity and richness over conventional formulas, becoming more selective in their viewing choices.

- **Interest in Documentaries:** Their appreciation for impactful storytelling is evident through recent purchases in documentary genres that provide insightful perspectives on historical and controversial topics.

- **Recent Shift in Preferences:** The user’s latest interaction reveals a marked discontent with certain acclaimed films, suggesting a growing intolerance for perceived mediocrity, which may indicate a narrowing focus on exceptional quality across all media.

**Overall Trends:** The user increasingly values emotional resonance and narrative complexity, demanding higher storytelling standards in films and series, signaling a preference for depth and engagement over fleeting trends.
